reviews.text: We only stayed one night, however, we would not have made it longer if we had the chance. I love quaint, independent hotels. The people generally treat you better and make you feel at home. That was not the problem here at all. First, I had paid for this room more than a month before our arrival and we did not get the room we were supposed to. Instead we had a very simple room with two beds, bathroom and fridge. I expected the larger room with the sofa/sitting area as was described when I booked it and a microwave. Not a huge deal, just a little disappointing. The beds were decent and the noise level was very low, which was good of course. Biggest problem was in the morning when we were greeted with very large bugs in the bathroom and vanity areas. We do not have these bugs where we live so I don't know if they were cockroaches or some strange very large beetle. They reminded me of a smaller version of the cockroaches I've seen in South Carolina, which are huge. These two that we flushed were about 1.5 inches. So, like my review started out, there's no way we would have stayed another night. We enjoyed the city of Santa Fe and the front desk people told us about a very good mexican food restaurant called Maria's. It was an awesome suggestion for dinner.
reviews.title: Not what we expected or read about

likes.liked: — Retreat away from busy Cerrillos Road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am very disppointed that the El Rey Inn had the problems we experienced and I'm hoping that future customers do not deal with anything of this sort.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Santa Fe. It is a great city to visit. I have never written a review before but our experience at the El Rey deserves comment. It was excellent. The price point is perfect. More for less. The room had a sitting area, fireplace and refrigerator . The look is total Santa Fe. Most importantly the service was terrific. From check in to the complimenary breakfast. At breakfast,as i was trying to carry food and drinks for two back to the room, a young server saw my plight and provided a tray. Then he asked if I would like a blueberry muffins. They had not been put out yet but he went out of his way to go to the kitchen and bring out muffins,butter etc. covered so I could carry them easily. El Rey has a homey atmosphere that lets you get away from the standard hotel experience. We will be back.
reviews.title: Great family oasis at a great price!

likes.liked: — great price with plenty of space

reviews.text: Our family of six loved our stay at El Rey! We stayed in a two bedroom, one bath suite with a kitchenette and living room area with two small sleeper sofas. Our unit had a nice Southwestern decor, and our kids loved the New Mexican style of the entire grounds. It was our son's birthday on our first night, and we had plenty of space for his "mini-party." The free continental breakfast was excellent, with warm muffins, instant oatmeal, canned peaches, strawberry and plain yogurt, and boiled eggs in addition to the usual bagel/cereal options. Our kids enjoyed the playground, and the outdoor pool was large, although it was closed. It was a five minute drive to the Plaza, and the staff was helpful in giving directions and suggestions. We liked it so much that we changed our travel plans to stay at El Rey again on our drive back to Texas. We will come back next year.
reviews.title: A must stay when in Santa Fe!!

likes.disliked: — breakfast for extended stays could be more creative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at The El Rey Inn a total of 6 times or more for 10 years now, most recently last week for 5 nights! It was a "girlfriend" trip and it was fantastic. The room was lovely and we made a fire every night. El Rey is a very charming, quaint, southwestern inn, great mattress/pillow, never slept better! The staff is awesome and my favorite person, Alice, unfortunately was away when I stayed, but she knows me when I visit! This is the ONLY place to lodge when in Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Pleasant experience.

likes.liked: — Southwest flavor and clean, clean room.
likes.disliked: — No WiFi and poor lighting in room for reading

reviews.title: Has gone way down hill
reviews.text: Though this hotel is charming enough from the outside, we were disappointed with the interior amenities and services. The hotel is WAY past its prime; the furniture is run down and decrepit, the sheets stained and the bathroom not thoroughly clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mattress was the incredibly rickety, and the headboard was falling apart. The sheets were yellowed in some areas, the blanket had holes. We were provided with two pillows. Both were flat, lumpy and incredibly unpleasant. I wouldn't be surprised if they were 50 years old. My fiance and I both woke up with sore necks.
reviews.title: Yes it is the best

likes.liked: — rooms full of santa fe charm
likes.disliked: — opening the door to see the car covered in snow !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom shower had clearly not been cleaned thoroughly; other peoples' *ahem* hairs were in it.
reviews.title: Reasonable and convenient with a touch of Santa Fe charm
Great price, great historic type property
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was as under- whelming as most are. In addition to the typically sub-par continental breakfast offerings, the staff person attending the otherwise empty breakfast room offered us what looked like five-day old Safeway muffins. When we refused them, he put them back in their package. We couldn't help but wonder how many times those muffins had been warmed-up, then tossed back in their box.
A disappointing stay at a run-down hotel that we would not recommend.
reviews.title: Really great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stay in Santa Fe at least once every month, and even though we may on occasion try a different lodging property, we always come back to the El Rey. The inn is a classic Route 66 motel which has done a great job blending the historic with the new, and vice-versa. The rooms are always very clean and well maintained. Each one also has unique furnishings so you won't wake up trying to remember what city you went to sleep in. We have tried many of the rooms since we like to experience the different atmosphere that each one has to offer. The inn is away from the traffic and noise of the plaza, both times that we stayed downtown we promised that we would never stay there again (lots of late night revelry). The inn's location on Cerrillos Road makes it convenient to all that Santa Fe has to offer. You'll get your kicks on this Route 66 motel.
reviews.title: A classic in Santa Fe

reviews.text: Most motels try to skimp and save to make the most profit. The El Rey appears to try hard to give the most luxury with its' property limitations. As others note, Cerillos Road is very busy, and the (first part of the) motel was built in 1936 along what was then the original Rte 66. However, with the use of courtyards and strategically places shubbery--the road noise is significantly dappened. The greenery is one reason why others have complained of "dark" rooms; my windows were surrounded by trees and bushes. My room was pretty small, but was decorated very nicely with wooden ceiling beams, nice lamps, and a floor to ceiling wooden clothing storage area. The TV screen was big, the bathroom fixtures were first rate, and the towels were luxury. There was a recycling bin in the room. Unfortunately, I could not get a WiFi signal in my room. The temp controlls worked well and the room was quiet. The surrounding grounds have very nice plants and they even have a greenhouse. There are nice picnic tables, a playground, and places to BBQ. The grounds are certified habitat, and I saw (and heard) lots of birds. The exercise room had one treadmill and one elipitical. Both worked well. There was a universal weight set wedged in a small area. There were no free weights (dumbells). The breakfast room is VERY nice. It is large and has a great sound system playing soothing music. The breakfast had a lot larger selection than most. You can not walk to downtown Santa Fe from this location, but there is a bus stop right beside the El Rey to take you downtown.
reviews.title: El Ray gives it the extra effort

likes.liked: — The diversity of plants & flowers on the grounds; the courtyards

reviews.text: My wife and I selected the El Rey Inn for our one night stay in Santa Fe on our way to a wedding in Taos. We were very pleasantly surprised by the wonderful atmosphere of the Inn, the cordial way that the staff treats visitors, and the delicious, mouthwatering complimentary breakfast. The Inn has an Old World feel with its architecture, ambience and beautiful grounds. It reminded us of Italian villas. The walls outside each room were decorated with colorful painted tiles. The tree-lined drives through the grounds added to the picturesqueness of the facility. We will definitely stay here again, hopefully for an extended stay since I am a plein air painter. In fact, I painted en plein air one of the buildings of the Inn while we were there.
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience in Santa Fe

likes.liked: — Its Old World Ambience; excellent breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tommy Thompson
reviews.title: A charming spot

reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a night at the El Rey to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Living in New Mexico, we had driven past the property many times and thought "it looks great in there, maybe we should check it out sometime"...so we did! The grounds are lovely and while we didn't use the hottubs, they looked very inviting (the pool wasn't open yet). The rooms are really nice...everyone is unique which is part of the appeal. While the hotel is a few minutes drive from the Santa Fe plaza, what you may give up in location you gain in ambiance. The continental breakfast was a nice start to the day and the staff was very pleasant. If you get a kick out of historical properties, you shouldn't miss a stay at the El Rey.
reviews.title: Pleasant and reasonably priced

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the outside decor.
likes.disliked: — Inside accomodations need updating, very small playground.

reviews.title: Fabulous Find! Can't Wait to Return.
reviews.text: After having lived in the area for over 3 years, I can't count the number of times we'd driven by the El Rey and commented that we should stay there. We finally decided to book, and I honestly think there's only one other property (closer to the plaza) that can compete. We'll be returning to the El Rey on a regular basis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many have commented, the El Rey is a classic family-owned property on Old Route 66. It is located immediately off of the busy Cerrillos Road, but the motel extends well beyond the road. This provides a quiet and solitude that is very unexpected.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved one of the rooms in a newer annex (deluxe king). It was set far from Cerrillos Road, adjacent to the pool area. The room was incredibly expansive with a king size bed, two small custom benches, armoire with tv, small closet, small fridge, gas kiva fireplace, and unusually large bathroom. Outside the room, we had two chairs and table. The bathroom was complimented with a glass block design that let natural light in. The main room was dark (as others have commented), but it wasn't depressing. During the day, the windows let plenty of light in. At night, lamps were more than sufficient. I would prefer the original architecture and wood touches to artificial designs and lighting.
reviews.title: Experience the Southwest at El Rey

likes.disliked: — The room was a little on the dark side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout the El Rey's property, you'll find various gardens and sitting areas. The pool area was decadent, and somewhere we chose to spend hours of our time. Pools can be hard to find in Santa Fe, so this was a treat. Near the pool was a jacuzzi, which was also pleasant.
reviews.title: Budget with a flair

likes.liked: — The decor was charming. I liked the special gardening touches. The cleanliness of the pool was a definite plus.
likes.disliked: — I wished the breakfast selection was more interesting.. And healthier---fresh fruit would have been nice. I think getting into the car and driving into town was a little tough but the distance is fairly insignificant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the next morning confirmed that about every room around ours had been occupied, we never heard another soul when in our room. The bed was very comfortable, and the window-unit AC (which could be controlled via remote control and set to exact temperature) kept the room nice and cool.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for groups and families
